page.title: 12MINOR ROUTES, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
The local network of small lanes and footpaths is very old, eg Butterhill Lane is an old drovers' road. The lanes are essential for access to farms especially for the collection of milk. Some are narrow with grass growing down the middle, and receive little mainten- ance from the Council. A few farms have privately owned tracks.
Some of these old routes are still bridleways or footpaths. They must have been important in the days before mechanisation. On the whole they are not well used now, as the local people prefer to use cars for their daily needs. However these footpaths are a valuable local amenity for those wishing to enjoy the rural scenery and a feeling of "returning to nature".
